intro: Hieracium ihrowyszczense, commonly known as the Ihrowyszczense hawkweed, is a perennial herbaceous plant native to Central and Eastern Europe. It belongs to the family Asteraceae, characterized by its composite flower heads and ray florets. The plant typically grows in meadows, grasslands, and disturbed soils, thriving in temperate climates. Its leaves are lance-shaped with rough textures, and its flowers are yellow with a central disk. Due to its limited distribution and specific habitat requirements, it is considered a rare and vulnerable species in some regions.
